reviews.text: We travelled from Barcelona, Spain with my husband and our 5-years-old daugter , and we stayed in a condo rented via www.rbo.com, our very confortable condo(great bed and matress), full kitchen, lovely livingroom Breakfast at Plantation cafe was not too much good but the staff was very kind. We had dinner at Aaron's Top on the 34 th floor and it was not too much expensive, and it was the only meal I really enjoyed in 21 days...(I missed a lot Spanish food, salads, more vegetables, ). On the 13th floor there is a laundrette, very convenient for a long trip if you don't want travel with lots of suitcases.....If a return to Hawaii some day I'll stay again in Ala Moana Hotel.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

likes.disliked: — no channels in spanish language in TV

reviews.text: The hotel is a Honolulu landmark. It's lobby is open and welcoming. The staff is friendly. The food service is appalling!!
reviews.title: Good choice if you're on a diet

likes.disliked: — Lack of food options, room service

reviews.text: No room service. Breakfast is limited to a breakfast buffet and closes at 10:00 am. If you want a cup of coffee after that time, you are directed to the adjacent mall. Lunch is limited to a very small selection by the pool or a Chinese Restaurant. If you want a drink, again you are limited to the pool bar or the Lobby Lounge which doesn't open until 5:00 pm. Although there is a bandstand in the lobby lounge, no music was provided on a Saturday evening. Not surprisingly, the lounge was dead.
reviews.title: Nice, clean and good price hotel

likes.liked: — clean, good location, price is low compared to Waikiki hotels, close to shopping mall

reviews.title: Rent Condohotel from Owner
reviews.text: My room was clean but small. The size was underscored by the over abundence of furniture. In addition to the king sized bed and the normal desk/bureau, there was a small couch, a chair and a coffee table. It was virturally impossible to walk in the room without bumping into something.

Our family stayed in the hotel for 8 days. We booked online for two queen beds in Kona, but when we checked in, the desired configuration was not available. So we were upgraded to Waikiki tower with extra $20/night. The room was small, but very clean. It was conveniently located and close to Waikiki, but with a much lower price. The shopping mall was very close, so we could eat in the food court, which has a good choice of Asian food (this was a plus for us). I enjoyed shopping every night after the dinner. This hotel is a good choice if you decide that you will tour Oahu a lot instead of staying on the beach for all the vacation. Since it was our first time and we drove to different places for the first few days, it worked out very well.
reviews.title: Love This Hotel FUN FUN FUN

reviews.text: After a long flight from Pennsylvania to Hawaii, we were pleased with the quality of this hotel. Free Internet service in the rooms was a huge plus as we were able to tell family & friends that we made it safely. Nice pool. Large, clean room. Excellent service. Hotel stored our bags for the day (for a fee of course) and had no trouble finding htem once we returned. Cabs readily available. Reception gave good directions for taking bus to see Pearl Harbor.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

likes.liked: — free Internet access in every room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I checked into the Ala Moana on July 3rd to July 8th. We stayed in a condo in the Waikiki Tower.
reviews.title: Not Fancy Schmancy but Fit the Bill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in there was a long line but the desk clerk was very friendly. We were able to check in early which we were very happy about. Our hotel room was clean with two queen beds, microwave, and refrigerator. The bathroom was clean too. There was also a small balcony with two chairs and a table. Our view was partially obscured by other large buildings but we weren't in our room much to mind.
reviews.title: Just okay

likes.liked: — Close to the Ala Moana mall

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was what we really enjoyed. If you want to stay in the heart of Waikiki..then don't stay here. But it's only a short bus/taxi ride away. It was nice not to be knee deep in tourists and the beach at Ala Moana Park across the street was a 3-4 minute walk. A lot of locals checked into the hotel on the 4th because it is so close to where the fireworks would be. We probably could have watched the fireworks from our room, but we chose to hang with the locals and enjoy the show up close. The fireworks were breathtaking and was 20 minutes long. (We've seen the fireworks in Sydney as well..and it gave them a run for their money.)
reviews.title: Beware.....

likes.disliked: — Management, Poor Customer Service, and they didn't listen to our side of the story (they only listened to their employees).

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel was EXTREMELY friendly and knowledgeable. Everyone from the parking attendants, to the bell desk, to the concierge (who printed directions for us) made us feel welcome. My mom sent us some goodies through room service and the hotel even followed up and called my mom to let her know they had been sent.
reviews.title: Choose carefully--this hotel may or may not be for you!

likes.disliked: — size of room, poor internet service, and the awful dampness in the room

reviews.text: Since this is the second time I stayed there, I was able to compare it to what it was like in 1999. It has been completely renovated. It's very modern and clean. I was lucky to have a partial view of the Ala Moana Park. There is a refrigerator in every room, which was convenient for my 5 day stay to help out with our sister office in Honolulu.
reviews.title: Modern and Clean

likes.liked: — I was able to navigate the different ways to get to my hotel room.
likes.disliked: — I wished someone could have just assisted me and booked my airplane seat for my return trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a walk distance to the famous Ala Moana mall, which is a convenient place to catch the bus to the business area and Waikiki.
reviews.title: Not sure to come back

reviews.text: The people in the hotel are very friendly. The few times I went to look for the concierge, he was nowhere to be found.
reviews.title: Business Centric Hotel - No Surprises
not worth it
reviews.text: I saw the small swimming pool but did not arrive there during its open hours.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For someone who did not bring my computer, I was surprised that they did not have any free computers to do some basic things such as confirm airplane seating.
reviews.title: Loved Ala Moana Hotel

reviews.text: We found a 2 bedroom condo high atop the Ala Moana and spent a week there last month. Since we stayed in a condo this review will be on the Hotel itself not the rooms.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our main purpose in going to Hawaii was fun on the beach & in the ocean.If that's your purpose this is NOT the best hotel for you. The beach at ALA Moana Park is QUITE a hike & then there are very few waves. It was too calm for us. We ended up taking a cab down to Waikiki when we were ready to swim each day.
reviews.title: Updated hotel in shopping end of Waikiki

reviews.text: It is connected to the Ala Moana mall which made shopping & eating very convenient. The staff at the hotel was very friendly. The elevators seemed to move fairly quickly so there was never much of a wait for one. Looks like they have done a recent renovation there so the lobby & hallways appeared nice not worn at all.
reviews.title: not great

reviews.text: So bottom line if you are there for meetings at the Convention Center this hotel should do you just fine. If you are interested in fun in the sun or nightlife move on down to Waikiki.
reviews.title: Good for Business Travelers and Shoppers not Families

reviews.text: Great hotel recently refurbished in Waikiki Tower. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was very swish. This was a privately owned condo the hotel sells off and rents.
reviews.title: poor accomodations

likes.liked: — room service came immediately when requesting an extra blanket
likes.disliked: — killed two roaches and too small for a couple and 1 child we should have been told

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You won't confuse this hotel for a Hyatt or Hilton, but it's a great value for being pretty much right in the middle of Honolulu. The staff is friendly and the location is pretty great. It's also a lot better than many of the shady non-resort places in Waikiki.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.text: Good: It's a great value, and is "attached" (sort of) to an enormous shopping and dining complex. There's trolley service to Waikiki for $2 each way, which beats the pants off trying to find parking. Ala Moana Beach Park is right across the street.
reviews.title: Good location for shopping
rock hard beds!!! Never again
reviews.text: Our room was pretty well equipped, and came with a refrigerator and microwave. Parking is $15 a night (as of September 2008) in the hotel garage - lower than most places in town.
Bad: The parking garage that connects the hotel to the shopping mall can be kind of shady at night. My wife and I were approach by vagrants several times.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings About Ala Moana

reviews.text: The walk to Waikiki is a little bit longer than it looks on a map - it was about a 30 minute walk for two reasonably in-shape people. But, if you aren't absolutely set on staying in Waikiki it's not that big a deal and (as above) there is a trolley service.
reviews.title: Great visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent 3 nights at the Ala Moana and it was great. The hotel was clean and updated. Our room was spacious and clean., had a microwave and refrigerator. The view from the balcony was great- we could see the ocean and the mountains-but we weren't there for the view. We were on the 21st floor so the city noise wasn't a problem. The Ala Moana mall was next door and had a great food court. Next visit to Honolulu we'll stay here again.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Ala Moana

reviews.text: I just got back from Hawaii on an 8 day vacation. This was my second time in Honolulu. I originally planned to stay in Waikiki again but decided at the last minute to do something different. The Ala Moana is not technically in Waikiki but it's only a 10 minute bus ride. You can easily walk in about 1/2 hour. It is right across the street from the Ala Moana Shopping Center-very large mall with Macys, Sears, Neiman Marcus and now Nordstroms. There's also a shopping area called Ward Center about a couple of miles down with movie theaters, restaurants, Ross, Nordstrom Rack and other stores. There is a beach park (Ala Moana) across the street. Downtown, Chinatown, and the piers are not very far away.
reviews.title: Very good location, decent accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was reasonably priced (under $200). I opted for a partial ocean view but would go for the ocean view next time. I advise that you choose a room in the Aloha Tower. The rooms in the Kona Tower all have mountain views. All rooms have refrigerators, many have microwaves. I did ask to change rooms as soon as I checked in because the room really did not appear to be clean. However, they were accomodating. While the room they moved me to was close to the elevator, the noise was minimal. It was clean and had both a microwave and a refrigerator. The main restaurant at the hotel is only open for breakfast and brunch on Sundays. There are a couple of other restaurants in the building but no room service. It is a very large hotel but is run efficiently. I would definitley stay here again.
reviews.title: Welcoming Experience

reviews.text: We encountered a welcoming experience at the Ala Moana Hotel. I was very skeptical because a few weeks before our arrival they received a bad review from a previous guest and the pool was closed for renovations. However, we followed through and was pleased. The hotel staff was courteous, the room was clean, and the view remarkable. The room had a safe, mini fridge, and upon request microwave. The hotel was centrally located to the piers and right next door the mall. We enjoyed our stay and will stay there again.
reviews.title: Great for shopping!

reviews.text: AB~WB
reviews.title: This is not a hotel!

likes.disliked: — horrible customer service and service from condo owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ala Moana Hotel provides the comfort and relaxation you look for on a trip to Hawaii. The front desk staff was condial and prompt. The hotel and rooms were clean and bright. I particularly recommend the pool and workout rooms. The restaurant on the roof, Aaron's, has spectacular views. The location is about a 30 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki, is right across from a the Ala Moana Beach Park (great for jogging), and has it's own entrance to the mall for end of day shopping. A wonderful way to see Honolulu.
reviews.title: Pure Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a Marriott clone, but half the price of the Honolulu Marriot, which is not unreasonable, since the rooms are about half the size.
reviews.title: A shopping mall with a hotel attached

likes.disliked: — Sofa offered as a second double bed

reviews.text: Visitors should be warned that, though rooms with two double beds are advertised, and we booked just such accommodation - months ahead - when we checked in we received a room with one double bed and a sofa that could be converted into a double bed. The management was not interested in discussing the matter. When this sofa was so extended, there was practically no floor space left.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms, no closet or drawer space, over-priced

likes.disliked: — uupholstered furniture and bedding with many disgusting stains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, both the Chinese restaurant and breakfast cafe serve good food, the Ala Moana shopping mall can be reached without going near a street, and the room was newly decorated. I would describe it as "cheap and cheerful".
reviews.title: An excellent alternative to Waikiki

reviews.text: Seriously, stay away from the ala Moana. My room had a microscopic closet, so small I could not put my suitcase inside.... a problem since the room is designed such that there is almost NO floor space. Small drawers as well with SIX phone books jammed into them. Flies in the room, broken A/C, and I really don't care to speculate on just what the stains on the bedspread and chairs are. Management unresponsive. Also no pool and no room service. So I can't figure out who this hotel thinks they cater to. Vacationers nee d a pool and business travelers need to hang up their clothes and get a meal while they work..
reviews.title: Mixed feelings, very nice room, view sucked, No service

reviews.text: Highly not recommended
reviews.title: Our 3 Weeks In Paradise by Hula girl from Adelaide, South Australia

likes.liked: — Grandeur, state of the art facilities, service

reviews.title: Hotel OK - Dining a big minus
reviews.text: On our third trip to Hawaii, we booked our hotel room directly via condo owner (vrbo). Staying on the 23rd floor, we experienced amazing views with rainbows on the horizon every day! As you step inside the hotel lobby, you are presented with an air of grandeur. Minimal waiting time for lifts and wide hallways gives a pleasant spacious ambience. Our room was compact, but for very clean and comfortable. We were travelling with our 20 year old daughter, and with all our shopping, still managed to enjoy our room. Loved having breakfast on the generous lanai. Never needed to draw the curtains, so experienced magnificent views morning and evening. The pool was closed for renovation during most of our stay, but was finished a few days before leaving. Beautiful renovations and were surprised how large and well equipped the pool area was. The facilities are absolutely fabulous, with state of the art gymnasium, sauna and steam room. Location is great, just take the walkway from the 2nd floor to the Ala Moana Centre for great shopping, restaurants (make sure you go to Californian Pizza Kitchen & Bubba Gumps) department stores, supermarkets.

A short bus ride or walk into Waikiki. Make sure you go to Aarons on the 36th floor to enjoy 360 degree views of Waikiki and Honolulu. This was our 3rd trip; have stayed in other hotels in Kuhio Avenue, paid alot more for sub standard accommodation.
reviews.title: Good if you're on a budget
